verses.roman:
prasādānna pasārira yata nā vikāya
dui-tina dina haile bhāta saḍi' yāya

synonyms: prasāda-anna—food of Jagannātha; pasārira—of the shopkeepers; yata—as much as; nā vikāya—is not sold; dui-tina dina—two and three days; haile—after; bhāta—the rice; saḍi' yāya—becomes decomposed.
translation: Lord Jagannātha's prasāda is sold by shopkeepers, and that which is not sold decomposes after two or three days.
